values.text: According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19 since you are symptomatic with shortness of breath. Kindly make sure go to the nearest Emergency Center and bring along your documents (Emirates ID and Medical Insurance card).

According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19 since you are symptomatic. Kindly make sure to check the nearest AHS clinic and bring along your documents (Emirates ID and Medical Insurance card).

According to a statement issued by the Abu Dhabi Media Office, the national sterilisation programme in the Capital will be from 8pm to 6am in residential areas, and 6pm to 6am in industrial zones and workers accommodations.

The National Sterilisation Programme in Dubai will be extended to 24 hours a day across all areas and communities for a period of two weeks subject to renewal. Individuals are not allowed to leave the house, except for essential purposes or if they are working in vital sectors exempted from the restrictions . If you wish to leave your home, make sure to submit a request here move.gov.ae. All people leaving home should wear a mask, gloves and ensure they keep a safe distance from others.

values.text: Ok let's start with a quick assessment. Have you traveled in the last 14 days ? Yes or No ?
Are you a self-pay patient? Yes or No ?
Do you have any chronic conditions? Any of the following or other? Immunocompromised, COPD, CKD, diabetes, hypertension, cardiovascular disease? Yes or No ?
Do you live in Dubai or Abu Dhabi ?

According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19, kindly self-isolate for 14 days AND DO the questionnaire again if patient develops symptoms. 
Testing for COVID-19 is not required however, if you choose to do the test, kindly note that as per government directive, the cost of the test will be covered by you. You can book an appointment at one of UAE's testing/screening centers and make sure to bring along your documents (Emirates ID and Medical Insurance card).

According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19, as there are other individuals sharing the same house with you. You are required to be transferred to a designated facility for isolation. Testing for COVID-19 is not required however, if you choose to do the test kindly note that as per government directive, the cost of the test will be covered by you. You can book an appointment at one of UAE's testing/screening centers and make sure to bring along your documents (Emirates ID and Medical Insurance card).

People who have the flu will typically experience symptoms within 14 days. The symptoms for COVID-19 can develop between 114 days. However, according to 2020 research, the median incubation period for COVID-19 is 5.1 days.
As a point of comparison, the incubation period for a cold is 13 days.
The symptoms of COVID-19 are similar in both children and adults. However, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), children typically present with fever and mild, cold-like symptoms, such as a runny nose and a cough. Check the symptoms differences in the below image.
If you are going for a screening or to a testing center, make sure to bring your Emirates ID and your Insurance card.

1- Call DHA Helpline on this number 800 342 to schedule an appointment.
2- Make sure to bring along your Emirates ID and Medical Insurance Card.
3- Head to the assigned hospital for your test:
	 3.1 Register with payment of 112 AED. 
	 3.2 You will get an initial assessment (Blood pressure, temperature, etc).
	 3.3 You will fill a self declaration form (Travel history, etc) 
	 3.4 Swab test (as medically prescribed). 
	 3.5 Get your results within 24 hours.
All schools, colleges and universities are closed until a further notice. To make sure education is still going all class sessions have been moved online
Yes, but order food that is cooked well and make sure to eat it while its hot.

Main guidelines to know about groceries:
-Make sure to ware gloves and mask, if not you will have to pay a fine.
-Grocery shops cannot exceed 30% of customers capacity.
-When returning home, it's better to keep your shoes out of your house, change the gloves and as for masks, if you have the cheap ones then throw them, if you have the better quality, then make sure to wash it and put it under the sun so it can dry out.
Drive Through testings cost around 370 AED, price might be slightly changed depending on the provider. Regular tests in Health Centers cost 112 AED.

Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) is a new strain of coronavirus, first identified in a cluster with pneumonia symptoms in Wuhan city,   Hubei province of China. Most of the cases were epidemiologically linked to the seafood and animal market. It started on 31st of December 2019, but unfortunately no one knows when it will end. Older adults and people of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions (Asthma, HIV, Cancer, Diabetes) might be at higher risk for severe illness from COVID-19.

In case of an emergency, you can call the following numbers while anywhere in the UAE:

911 for Police
998 for Ambulance
997 for Fire Department (Civil Defence)
996 for Coastguard
991 for electricity failure
922 for water failure.

Call for help, information and services related to the 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID-19) through the following channels:

Ministry of Health & Prevention at 800-11111 
Estijaba service at the operation center Department of Health  Abu Dhabi at 800-1717 
Dubai Health Authority at 800-342.

If you have taken the test and the result is positive, a team member of the test center will contact your for the required procedure. You can always check with your test center as the laboratories are working 24/7 to ensure accurate results at the earliest time.

- Always make sure to wear masks and gloves when you leave your house
- Practice social distancing by keeping at least 6 feet (about two arm lengths) away from others
-Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds
-Stay home if you can and avoid any non-essential travel.

Only people working in vital fields, including energy, communications, medical, police, army, pharmaceutical, electricity and water, airport and immigration, banking, mass media and construction sectors, as well in petrol stations, will be allowed to leave home for now.
All pets are safe, they have no chance to pass and infect you with the corona virus. Please do not abandon your pets.
You can only take your car if it's an emergency. It's advised to stay home. In case you have an emergency, a maximum number of three persons is allowed inside cars.
Dubai Metro and Tram services will be suspended from April 5 until further notice. Public buses are available for free, and taxis are giving 50$ discount.
Public buses are available for free, and taxis are giving 50$ discount.
Don't worry about your pet. As clinics are under essential services, they are still operating.
All shops are closed. Only supermarkets and pharmacies are open 24/7. Vet clinics and service providers (laundries, banks, food providers, etc...)as well are open.
Supermarket and pharmacies are open 24/7.
For now, SEHA has drive through screening centers in Abu Dhabi, and more are opening soon.
We just sent you an SMS with locations of Abu Dhabi's Health Care Centers.
According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19, kindly book an appointment for screening at one of UAE's drive through centers. Make sure to bring along your required documents.

According to  assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19, kindly provide the needed information and book an appointment for screening at one of UAE's screening hubs  OR  one of UAE's drive through centers.
